messageBody:
Untitled Document





Workshop on "Structured Unit Testing"
28th September 2002
Hotel Centaur, New Delhi.
www.WhatisTesting.com and www.stagsoftware.com




stag (software test and analysis group) software private limited specializes in "methods and tools" for software test engineering.

www.WhatisTesting.com and stag are together organizing a one-day workshop on "Structured Unit Testing" whose objective is to help you devise a strategy for testing an unit, discuss black-box techniques to design tests, help assess adequacy using white-box techniques, device test suites using a simple automation framework.

1111
Date 28th September 2002
Timings 9.30 AM to 5.30 PM
Course fee1 Rs.5, 000 per participant
Task Force of 41 Rs.18, 000 (i.e. Rs.4, 500 per participant)
Consultant11 Mr. T. Ashok - Director,stag software private limited




--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Consultant's profile
Mr. T. Ashok is the founder Director of stag software private limited, a test engineering company based in Bangalore, India. He has over fifteen years of experience in the software discipline and has worked in all the phases of software development cycle.

He has conducted corporate trainings in this area for companies like Novell, Sasken, Hewlett-Packard, Philips, CISCO, Deutsche Software, Digital, Siri Technologies, BPL Telecom etc. He is active in the test community and has presented papers and conducted tutorials in the International conferences on testing like Quality Week (US and Europe), QAI's International Test Conference and SEPG Conference in India.


Objective of the workshop
The earliest entry point to validation is testing at unit level. Validation at the earliest opportunity preventing some of the implementation issues to slip into later stages is most cost-effective

This workshop will help you devise a strategy for testing an unit, discuss black-box techniques to design tests, help assess adequacy using white-box techniques, device test suites using a simple automation framework. Some common checklists/guidelines to aid cost-effective unit testing, OO/Structured-based units and how OO impacts unit testing will also be discussed.

Contents

Introduction to unit testing

-Objective of unit testing
-Definition of unit
-Types of faults that should be detected at unit testing

Black box-test design techniques

-Boundary value analysis
-Equivalence classes
-Special value
-Input/Output domain testing
-State based, Decision-table based testing

White box techniques

-Statement coverage
-Condition/Multiple condition coverage
-Path coverage
-File, Class, Function/Method coverage
-How much coverage do I am for?test execution

Generating small yet effective test cases

-Single fault/Multi-fault
-Orthogonal arrays

Testing OO units(Classes)
- Information hiding and how this affects testability
-Validation of an individual method
-Testing polymorphic methods
-Testing class modal behavior i.e. inter-relationships of methods
-Testing abstract classes
-Testing generic classes
-What to test in a derived class

Checklists/guidelines that aid in validation of unit
-Units that are typically user interface
-Units that are typically libraries
-Units that parts of components/frameworks

Fault models in execution and techniques of detection
-Resource leakage
-Performance issues
-Error recovery issues
-Portability issues
-Concurrency issues
-State related issues

Test documentation
-How much to document in a unit test plan
-A simple style of document unit cases quickly and easily

Automating unit tests
-Framework for unit test automation
-Writing test drivers
-Writing test oracles

Methodology
This is one-day workshop consisting of classroom discussions and a problem solving/case-study session.

Training material
The hard copy of the course slides will be given to every participant.

Who must attend?

Developers
Test Engineers

Prerequisites
Good programming knowledge in at-least one language
